v 1.0:
• first release //Help Dialogs Saving bookmarks Show again: Saving bookmarks? To save a bookmark simply click the icon at the toolbar. If you clicked the icon a popup appears. You can now edit the title of the bookmark.

You can switch back to the main screen or to your favorite (look into the settings) by clicking the toolbar. To go back to the main screen you can also press the arrow at the toolbar. Swipe down to reload the website. Browser Show again: Functionality of the browser? HHS Moodle is shown in this webview. A webview displays websites in an app. If you have no internet connection they will be loaded offline from the cache (this works not o course overviews). If you want to be logged automatically, you must set your username and your password in the settings.

In the webview there is a context menu, which opens on long pressing a link or image.

You can switch back to the main screen or to your favorite (look into the settings) by clicking the toolbar. To go back to the main screen you can also press the arrow at the toolbar. Swipe down to reload the website. Main screen Show again: Tip about the main screen? The tabs:
In the left tab you can open your personal Moodle sites. In the right tab you can see your bookmarks.

Edit bookmarks:
Long click on a bookmark opens a popup menu. You can set your favorite bookmark (It can be loaded on app start or on title bar click - look in the settings.), edit the title of the bookmark or delete it (at least one bookmark is needed). Making screenshots Show again: Taking screenshots? You can make screenshots of the whole website (even of the part which is outside of your display. Before taking the screenshot wait until the website is fully loaded, to ensure that the whole website is captured. Taking notes Show again: Taking notes? Create notes:
You can make notes if you click the \"Taking note\" entry in the menu or the pencil icon in the toolbar.

Working with notes:
Clicking a list entry opens the note. Long click on an entry opens a popup menu. You can edit title and content of the note or delete the note (at least one note is needed).
You can also set a notification to the system status bar. A new screen for editing notifications will open. The notification will appear again after a reboot. Permission dialog Show again: Permission dialog?
